Reviews.Title: “friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: allan m
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 5 days.This hotel has a very friendly staff, and I really feel safe in this hotel room is really clean. it is near the mtr..The thing is it is not for tourist its more on a businessman type of a hotel!Visit the sugar bar at the 32nd floor.. Over all the Hotel experience is very good!

Reviews.Title: “No Loyalty”
Reviews.Author: Shirlspuipui
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel third time and each time is long stay. Im Chinese myself and born in hong kong. I know land is very expensive in hk so won't complain the size of rooms. However every time I visit this hotel for as least 10 days and pay in advance. No offer complimentary breakfast or room upgrade or even a fruit plate. I'm quite disappointed in that way and think whether I should stay with them again next time I visit hk.

Reviews.Title: “Great economic room”
Reviews.Author: Lancy W
Reviews.Content: Me and friends stayed in this hotel for 4 nights. Not bad cause this is the best rate hotel I could found in HK. It near to MTR and many nice cafes and typical hk restaurants nearby. And few shopping malls too. Room is small, that is common in HK. Is not a problem for us as the room is really clean yet comfortable even though the bed is a bit hard.

Reviews.Title: “Silka stay”
Reviews.Author: phievargas
Reviews.Content: We had a hard time finding it, not to mention that not all Chinese speak nor understand English (this is sad). From the Tsuen Wan train station, they should have us picked up but no. We had to find our own way with our heavy luggages and hungry kids. This is so hard for us first timers in HK. When we finally reached it, we are all sweaty and tired. What added insult to the injury was our room- so closed and small for a booked triple-sharing with 2 kids sneak-in. We had to rearrange and request for additional beddings. The only good thing in this hotel was the buffet breakfast. Definitely not booking again here.

Reviews.Title: “Very small room, bad experience”
Reviews.Author: Nivriti
Reviews.Content: Me and my husband stayed in this hotel for 3days.The rooms were so small and hardly had any space to keep our luggage.the bathrooms we small too. There were no complementary water in rooms.The bed was not comfy and quilts were not good quality.The Heater was not working properly and room/bed remained cold.The breakfast was good and had variety of both western and chineses style food.They had free Internet service from 6.30-10am in breakfast hall.The only good thing was the location,it was close to Tseun Wan MTR station.Free shuttle bus service of the hotel was ok and just went to 2 places. We would definitely not come back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very small room”
Reviews.Author: Sun P
Reviews.Content: My sister and I stayed at this hotel last Feb. 15-17 2012 our room was so small we hardly had no room for our 2 small luggage , carpet was dirty, our beds had bedbugs. Bathroom walls were also dirty had so little room to dress after showering either your body touches the shower curtain , the dirty walls or the toilet bowl. Breakfast was just average very few food choices. The receptionist staff was very curt and dismissive they could hardly speak and understand English. The only saving grace for this hotel it was near the MTR if you don't mind a little walk and it was just beside a small mall. Will definitely not be coming back in this hotel ever again!!!

Reviews.Title: “small rooms!”
Reviews.Author: AllySuffolk
Reviews.Content: Yes these room are soooo small. OK if you want to taste the streets of Tsuen Wan as it's by the centre. Also link for transport are good as next door to the MTR and bus station. Tried breakfast one morning. It was below average in my opinion with little choice. Rooms have no heating so quite cold in Feb. The hotel will add extensions to the bed if you wish but that leaves little room to get in the room LOL.Had one issue of staff trying to get in my room at 5am, had the catch on but not a good experience! Have moved to the Royal View on the edge of Tsuen Wan. See my review for that, no comparison!!!

Reviews.Title: “i will never come back in this hotel.. room is very small.”
Reviews.Author: Elektra1706
Reviews.Content: Me and my husband stayed in this hotel for 2 days. I never expected the room is very small. I have tried to stayed at other budget hotels previously and their rooms were not as small as Silka Far East... The only goog point in this hotel is that they are very near to Tsuen Wan Station, near to malls, shops and resto but we will not definitely come back in this hotel ever again.

Reviews.Title: “Hard Bed!”
Reviews.Author: travelandfashion
Reviews.Content: We expected the rooms to be small since its a budget hotel. However, the beds are hard! didn't get much sleep because of it. Rooms didn't have heater (and i'm not talking about water heater). the only great about this hotel is it's near the MTR about10mins walk and mall/restaurants in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Small Room-Maybe will try again.”
Reviews.Author: LOVEME2011
Reviews.Content: I'm tempted to give a poor rating because of the following points: small room, small bathroom & repeat breakfast menu but still I will retain my average rating. Well, the location is great-close to MTR, malls, park bus stations, 7 eleven etc which are really convenient for first timers like us. But the room is really small. When I lay down in bed I can hear the other room's noise and most of the time-the shower or a running water inside the pipe. But I was too tired to complain about it.Breakfast has lots of options but they didn't change it. They have free internet on the 6th floor too. Take note that they're charging 30HKD per hour for an internet connection. That saddens me.

Reviews.Title: “Will not return-poorly maintained hotel very cramped rooms”
Reviews.Author: SK8888
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 nights. Hotel carpets in corridor and rooms stained/dirty. Bed was very hard like a wooden plank. Sleepless nights because you can hear neighbours talking into night and people talking in corridor -paper thin walls. I get woken a few times a night by people next door using the toilet. The water running through pipes make a very loud almost mechanical sound loud enough to drown your TV volume. My children's room did not have this problem because it was at the end of corridor. Room is very tiny and cramped about 9' x 9 ' excluding the tiny bathroom. Only good points are its location (5 mins to Tsuen Wan MTR), free shuttle bus to Mongkok and many dining facilities nearby. Reception and concerige not bad. Unless you are on a shoe string budget and do not mind a sleepless night, look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “so-so hotel”
Reviews.Author: lacain18
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights. I chose this budget hotel because some of the reviews here said the room and bathroom although tiny, were clean...NOT TRUE. The bathroom tiles had mildew and the shower curtain smelled. The carpet was also stained and looked old. And for 3 straight days, they served the same food for breakfast. Am not coming back to this place.

Reviews.Title: “Very Cosy & Clean”
Reviews.Author: Weltenbummlers
Reviews.Content: Room is tiny, but extremely clean and modern, with everything you could need. We are a mature couple and found the experience appropriate to being in Hong Kong. The lack of space was no problem: we stored one case above the tv and didn't mind moving the others out of the way when necessary! Staff very helpful. Location brilliant as it's a short distance from the 'metro' (albeit a fair way out of the centre, although this made it a more authentic experience). Great shopping with a choice of large shopping malls, local markets and small shops. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Tiny and Far.....but we already know this...”
Reviews.Author: spidey13
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nights in September. Agree with other reviewers - the room is very small. If you come with 2 medium size luggage - there won't be any space to move, which is exactly what happened to us. I had to leap from bed to bed to get across the room. The toilet comes with a rainshower. Its a pity the shower area is so small - but the rainshower is really good, strong pressure. Location wise, its not anywhere central. Its the last stop on the Tsuen Wan line (the Red colour MTR, not to be confused with Tseun Wan West). The MTR is a walkable 10-15 minutes. Its across the road, you need to cross using the overhead bridge. Overall, I'll say this is an okay hotel. I have read the reviews and know that its tiny and not centrally located. Reason I book this hotel is due to its low price. Oh, and the hotel provides free shuttle service to Tsing Yi station to catch the Airport Express. They do several trips daily and I believe to Mong Kok as well. Do enquire at the concierge.

Reviews.Title: “I Wish We Stayed Somewhere Else...”
Reviews.Author: Maice_S
Reviews.Content: It wasn't TERRIBLE, and maybe it's different now (we stayed at Dorsett back in December of 2009 as part of our yearly travel for my Dad's birthday) - but it wasn't great either - not by a long shot. We wanted to save money so we could spend more on shopping (and we are a shopping bunch) so we decided to book here. It was definitely much cheaper - so I guess you get what you pay for (or a bit less than that, even). *BTW I selected November 2010 for when I traveled because December 2009 was no longer present in the dropdown :) The rooms were TINY - it's practically just space with a bed and a tiny bathroom. The hotel itself also did not look very good - not terrible again, but it was very average (maybe going below average). The breakfast was so-so. Only real advantage to this place was location - very accessible. But given the rooms were so tiny - it was hard to find space to put our shopping bags in... Now that we know, next time we visit Hong Kong (maybe next year?), we will invest in a more expensive hotel. :) If you are the type who will be shopping majority of the time anyway and just go to your hotel to crash - you might be okay with this place. Well, unfortunately that's what we thought too - but we ended up wishing we booked elsewhere. Feel free to book here still, just set your expectations. :)

Reviews.Title: “Small Room but well maintained Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mooksian
Reviews.Content: For - Close to MTR , Shopping centre, and lots of places to eat either local or western food. Hotel was clean , provided transport to MTR stations for airport or Disney Land and had a good breakfast Against - Tiny rooms, small shower area (when you moved you could not avoid turning the show off) , smoking smell in non smoking areas , very hard short beds. Suggest don't ask for a double but ask for a twin bed if you are sharing. No free wi-fi.

Reviews.Title: “~A friendly hotel in the Far East~”
Reviews.Author: Giovanni P
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very accessible to nearby trnasportation either by taxi, bus or train. what i like most is the night view from our room. One could witness the skyscraper view buildings of HongKong straight from your bed since they have a huge glass window. That's one thing for sure your eyes could copy and remember by your brain cells. One more thiing by the way, water is very important in Hong Kong, when travelling. see to it, you bring along with you water canteens. One could ask for free water from one of the hotel staffs. They are very friendly and considerate. The food they offered during breakfast is free. Just make your negotiations with the hotel when you do reservation with them. The hotel rooms though are not spacious but the beds are very comfortable. Luggages do not have enough space but just bear with it for what is important is the experience you will earn from travelling.

Reviews.Title: “Clean but airport or MTR shuttle could make it better”
Reviews.Author: lwpilot
Reviews.Content: The hotel was clean. We stayed in a very small room - should be ok for asians. Do your research ahead of time to find the hotel - there is no free shuttle from airport to hotel but there is a shuttle from the hotel that will bring you to the Tsing Yi MTR station (airport express train). A good way to find it is - take the train to (Tsing Yi MTR) then get a taxi to bring you to the hotel. We opted to take the train then hop to another train and walk a little to find the hotel. The finding part was scary if you dont know your way around and lugging along your luggage. Best part was the cleanliness and cold ac, we stayed at the 12th floor so little or no noise. We did not like the lack of info on how to get there or the lack of service from airport to hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Tiny but friendly”
Reviews.Author: ANDAMANPhuket_
Reviews.Content: Located far from the action in centre of Kowloon. Its called Tsuna Wan. You can reach by MRT Tsuan Wan (the end of the line) walk out form Gate B cross the fly over to the otherside of the street, keep left & go straight. Hotel is right on the main road with easy access to everywhere. Bus stop in in front of the Hotel, you can even take an Airport Bus # A31 from the Airport. Some size is so tiny but by Hong Kong standard. the bed is comfy but too short if you are 6" feet tall. The bath room is also small, only shower available with amenities (no bathtub) when you take a shower, its wet all over the place and you have to get dress ouside the bathroom. Anyway, room is clean, enough amineties, clean towel & bed sheet (replenished everyday). Refrigerator is not working well (not cold enough and can not adjust). You are only spend a few hours in the room so who care about the size as long as its clean & safe. Check-in/Check out is fast & efficient, staff speak fairly English & can help you with information & direction. You can leave your luggage after check out (free) and pick up later. Tsuan Wan is not a Tourist Freindly District. You have difficulty in communicate in English. People speak Chinese but you can survive but you have to work hard on your finger & hand...SInce you are near the MRT & Bus Stop, then, you can go anywhere in Hong Kong without any problem. I chose this hotel because I travelled with family and their intention was to visit Disneyland, Big Buddha & Nong Ping Cable car & Citygate Outlet as It is very near to all these places. I would definitely recommend this hotel to all if you are planning to do the same..( This hotel is now called SIlka Far East )

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Location!!”
Reviews.Author: Navkant
Reviews.Content: - Had booked the room direftly thru their website with a 3N2D deal. - Had reached HK thru TST ferry terminal and got on an MTR to reach Tsuen Wan station. - DFE is just a 5minutes walk from the MTR exit, however had to struggle for 15mins to reach the first time around (had taken a wrong exit on the Walkover bridge) - Tip - Checkout the MTR exit information and take the Exit B2 and continue on the Walkover bridge and get down towards the City Landmark mall of the Castle Peak road. - Had booked a non-smoking room and got it as desired. - Room was on 11th floor, it was tiny but had a great view. - Basic facilities were provided and the bed was comfortable. - The location of the hotel is awesome as you can commute to any place of the City thru MTR within 1hr. Loved the fact and took 4-5 trips to the City thru MTR only. - Also got a complimentary drop to Airport Line (10mins drive) - Overall, loved the stay just coz of the location and that is the only thing to talk about this hotel... - Dint like the hotel providing WiFi at 30$/hour where in the HK govt shares a free WiFi across city.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms are way too small you'll be in disbelief when you enter!”
Reviews.Author: heynowbeaches
Reviews.Content: They tried too hard to fit 2 single beds in their rooms. The beds are not even your regular and standard single-sized beds and there is not even enough room left for your luggage. We managed to squeeze 2 medium-sized luggage inside but there was barely enough floor space left after for you to walk on. And the rooms and corridors look old and worn out. The only good points about this hotel are the short walk going to the Tsuen Wan MRT station, the lobby is roomy and clean, and the front desk people are friendly. We made a big mistake with this one. It was not even that close to Disneyland. If you're on a budget, look elsewhere as you will really feel like you wasted every single cent you spent if you stay at this hotel. The savings you'd get will not be worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Too small room and noisy”
Reviews.Author: Jrdolce
Reviews.Content: It was a first time in Hongkong. This hotel room is very small and nothing protection for sound between each rooms. However during three days,breakfast menus are same everyday.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay”
Reviews.Author: HiteshWadher
Reviews.Content: Location of the hotel is very good. Just opposite to the Tsuen Wan MTR station. There are good malls besides the hotel for shopping. Hotel is clean but the rooms are very small. But overall I enjoyed my stay in dorsett far east hotel. the hotel provides free shuttle buss service to Tsing Yi airport express station and mongkok

Reviews.Title: “Appropriate for people who are out and about! :)”
Reviews.Author: jbaniel
Reviews.Content: When we first opened the door to our hotel room, we were quite surprised as to how tiny the room was. It was quite different from the picture posted :D Nonetheless, we figured that we got what we paid for. :D The service was great, especially the front desk. They were very friendly. On our second to the last day, my Dad and I decided to split up so we could shop without pressuring the other. The problem was they only provided one key. So my dad left the key with them and asked the girl in the front desk that its possible that his daughter would be picking up the key, whoever was first to arrive. I arrived first, another receptionist was up front, he asked me to wait since they were not allowed to give out keys. Luckily, the girl remembered what my dad asked. :D The buffet was good, just don't compare it to 4-5 star hotels. The location is near an MTR Station so it is very convenient for those who are always on the go. But if you are coming from the airport, I suggest just take the MTR and forego the bus trip or taxi trip. The traffic can be quite bad in the middle of the day. It is also near 2-3 malls so you always have a place to wander in. It's beside a 7-11 so you know you will not go hungry or run out of essential supplies :) If I had just one complain, its the fact that the rooms are close to each other and the walls are thin, so you can literally hear the other occupants go to the toilet or use the shower, and if chatter, you will hear that too. But since we were always dead tired from all the walking and looking around, it wasn't a big deal. Basically, if you are on a budget, this is a great hotel to stay in and you wouldn't feel robbed of the money that you paid for it. Its great for those who are on business trips and even those who are on leisure trip that are always exploring and touring. Not for those people who want the extravagant hotel experience. If I were to suggest anything, it would probably to have free wi-fi connections in their room, or even free wi-fi in their function rooms or increase the number of computers in the function room. And to have more than one key for each room :D

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: porkiechris
Reviews.Content: Yes, all the reviews about the rooms being small are true. BUT, the location is what was the best part of this hotel. It is close to everything!

Reviews.Title: “Fine if you are not looking for luxury”
Reviews.Author: dancingfeetManila
Reviews.Content: Hi, stayed at Dorsett FarEast Hotel from December 1 to 3, 2010. As for location, it is very okay, 5 minutes walk to MTR station Tsuen WAn (RedLine), 5 minutes to Wellcome Supermarket, a minute walk to 7-11, your next door neighbor is a big department store , The Landmark, it has everthing other malls offer like brandname items le.,cosmetics that give exactly same promos as othe big name malls like Times Square and Harbour City in TST. It is not a touristy area but more of a local neighborhood that offers all the modern conveniences, it has a lot of eateries around it, local ones and the usual Spaghetti House, Cafe de Corral, MacDonalds. Tsuen wan Station is on the Redline which other end station is Central Staion .(business district). Only 30 minutes away and no need to transfer trains when you have business to attend to in the cbd. As for sleep quality, it is true what others said that the beds are small and hard., but for Asians with small frame, size of room and bed is okay. The first night I tossed and turned a lot because of the hard bed, but on the second nighr after spending all day in DIsneyland, I was so tired that I nodded off immediately after hitting the sack, the next moment I know it is morning already. Twin sharing rooms we got just has a shower stall which is okay, since I am not a fond of bath tubs. They provide basic toiletries and paper slippers for the guests. THe breakfast at their cafe on the 6th floor is adequate,, no fancy gourmet stuff but better than eating at MacDonalds. Sample Breakfast Buffet includes pork sausges, chicken sausages,fish siomai, milk, juice, coffe, tea, different kinds of breads and rolls, beans in tomato sauces, scrambled eggs, canned fruits, chinese congee with choice of scallions, peanut, salted eggs and pickled vegetable toppings, Hotel service is decent and provide all your basic needs. For a no frills traveller, Dorsett Fareast is a good place to stay. It is a budget hotel but it provides free transfer to Airport, (which saves you the bother of lugging your shopping items when tranferring stations when using the Airport Express), to TsingYi ( half way to Disneyland) and Ladies Market. ( in MongKok) . Really budget friendly around $60 usd a night. Would consider to stay here again in my next trip.. But if you have money to burn and have a yen for luxurious ambiance, this is DEFINITELY not the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “Stay only if its the last available 3 star and above hotel available in Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: kevinrao
Reviews.Content: The hotel is clean. Its near enough to the MTR. Thats about the only good thing about this place. Its too expencive for the value it provides. I stayed for 3 nights for HKD3080. The rooms were the smallest I had in Hong Kong. the other hotels were pegion holes but this place takes the cake. They dont even provide you mineral water in the room. About the only decent channel is Fox News. Breakfast is pitiful and its not inclusive in the HKD 3080 that I paid. Its too far from everything just as the name suggest it is the far east. Staff are unfriendly. they tried to force me to pay an additional 50% penalty when I tried to check out on day one. The bed was hard. I am too frustrated to tell you all the things thats wrong with this hotel. My conclusion the only reason you should stay here would be that its the only last available 3 star and above hotel in the whole of hong kong. I did not have a mainland visa. If I did I would have rather moved to shenzen and comuted daily to hong kong from shenzen rather than stay in this hotel thats how fed up with this place.

Reviews.Title: “Not a good hotel at all”
Reviews.Author: dr_dohh
Reviews.Content: My 50+ office colleagues all stayed here on our company outing. So I have no idea how much the rooms were, or what the group package was worth. So all I can talk about is the hotel itself. By far, this the SMALLEST hotel room I've ever seen, much less stay in. Literally, there was no place for two medium hardcase suitcases. The distance between one bed and the other was less than 2 feet. I cannot imagine how my 6 foot tall office mates can sleep in such a small bed. I gave 2 stars since it wasn't dirty. Outside the room there was nothing remotely interesting. A 7-11 beside the hotel is the nightlife, and a few 'meh' malls are in close proximity. One upside this hotel has is that its close to the metro train system, plus its about 20 minutes away from HK Disneyland. Another one is that they have free breakfast. Not great, but better than getting nothing. Overall, I would tell anyone looking for a hotel in HK to stay away from this one.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable service at such a low price”
Reviews.Author: Yeaher
Reviews.Content: The room rate is simply amazing as it was a great save for us as we stayed there for 5 nights. Probably one of the Top 5 cheap hotels in the expensive HK. Yes, the room is small and there is no bathtub. But we were fine with the shower. And we actually love the location as it is close to MTR station and nearby are many cheap food choices. Honestly this hotel is not ideal for first-time travellers to Hong Kong as it is quite far away from the mainstream tourist spots. The room service is not very good. They did tidy the room everyday but they didn't change the bedding sometimes! And we can see the hair left on the bedding...... And one ALERT: the air-conditiioning is SUPER cold. I suspect there is no individual room conditioning. We can just turn on or off the air-con. And for the second nights and on we needed to turn off the aircon overnight to sleep. It was just FREEZING.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed my stay at a Tsuen Wan Hotel, Kowloon, HK”
Reviews.Author: terlim51
Reviews.Content: Stayed a few nights at this hotel which is in Tsuen Wan District, Kowloon, Hong Kong. Before arriving I had some reservations about its location as it's quite far from the usual tourist destinations such as Nathan Road and Tsim Tsha Tsui. To my surprise T W is modern and buzzling with activities. Within walking distances, there are many modern shopping malls ,cheap restaurants and hawker stalls. Besides there's also an MRT station nearby . It's only 13 stops to TSTsui ,fare $9 about 30 min duration The hotel room was clean and quiet ( at the 12 floor) although a bit small.The hotel staff are friendly and professional. This hotel also provides free shuttle bus service to Mongkok ( Ladies Market) for its quests. I recommend this hotel for holiday makers who do not want to spend a lot on accomodation in expensive Hong Kong.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel for a budget traveler”
Reviews.Author: Cel77
Reviews.Content: Located in Tsuen Wan District, Dorsett Far East is not ideal if you are going to HongKong for shopping since it is not located at the city center. There are nearby shops that you can go into and a nearby Mc Donalds to have meals in a jiffy. The receptionists are accomodating although some of them speak limited English. We stayed in a room fitted to people of small to average sizes. Since we are Asians, this is pretty much acceptable but I guess for American or European standards, the room would be very small. Cleanliness is apparent and commendable. The room and the hotel environment are clean and well-maintained. Overall, I would recommend this hotel to a budget traveler who wouldn't mind being away from the bustling city center.

Reviews.Title: “Sweeter the 2nd time around”
Reviews.Author: ManFromTheEast
Reviews.Content: chose dorsett far east again since i was travelling on business and would be away the whole day, just needed a place to sleep and shower basically. hence, dorsett far east got the nod. was with my business partner this time and couldn't complain anymore about the smell of cigarette on our non-smoking floor. they must have fixed it. also, same as before, the check-in and out was efficient. cleanliness was 2nd nature to them, probably. overall, no complaints this time. would stay there again for short business trips.

Reviews.Title: “Too far from Hong Kong's Shopping Centers; clean but very small rooms”
Reviews.Author: elenjohos
Reviews.Content: Strong Points: - Affordable rates - Quiet Location, - clean rooms and bathroom - there's a good burger joint right beside it - near MRT station Downside: - Location is too far from shopping centers and HK Disney - rooms and bathrooms are very very small. You cannot move from one end of the room to another without bumping into a chair or table.There is no place for your suitcase except on the floor, which would make it harder for you to move around the room. Bathroom is very tiny. Don't make a mistake of turning around while in the shower; you'll end up "wrapped" with the shower curtain. That's how small the bath area is. - Nearest McDonald's was a long walk from the hotel. So even if I had free breakfast vouchers from McDonald's, I wasn't able to use them. - The coffee shop was bare and unattractive. It looked more like a school cafeteria. The staff in their coffee shop was such a snob. My reservations in this hotel did not include breakfast, so when my son and I sat down in the coffee shop to have breakfast, a waiter approached me, then looked at me as if I wont be able pay for our breakfast. - Some staff in the lobby hardly spoke nor understood English.

Reviews.Title: “Never seen anything like this”
Reviews.Author: pupu456
Reviews.Content: On scandinavian standards this wouldn't be even called a hotel. Rooms are really really tiny, no window, funny smell, beds are short and hard and you can hear the neighbours and the water running in pipes. Only reason to stay in this hotel is that you don't have the money for anything better.

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT EVEN CONSIDER THIS HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: GCCouple
Reviews.Content: My Wife , I and our 15 year old daughter stayed at this hotel for 3 nights. We looked the pictures on the hotels web site and thought this would be reasonable. Not.(ultra WIDE LENS)...... To start with we had trouble fitting the 3 of us in the lift and I stayed down in the foyer and waited for the lift to come back down.We are small people. We then proceeded to the room and after opening the door it got stuck 2 thirds of the way as the bed was in the way. The room had a double and 1 single bed and our 3 bags (medium sized) had to be stacked on their ends against one wall as they could not fit on the floor due to the lack of space in the room. The bathroom was the size of a broom closet. The shower floor was 450mm x 500mm and had a curtian that was useless. The room had no window and was very dirty. I approached the manager and asked him if we had been given the wrong room and he said that all the rooms are the same. Breakfast was cold as ice and not very tasty. Internet was expensive and only on one PC in the dinning room. It's location is right at the end of the train line. (to far away from Koowloon centre) The staff provided very little help. You have been warned

Reviews.Title: “Good service, So-so location, TINY rooms”
Reviews.Author: exnihilo75
Reviews.Content: My friend and I laughed when we saw the size of our rooms. The sleeping area was maybe 10ft. by 10ft. The beds were much smaller than standard twin and were on the hard side. I am about 6'2" and my feet were hanging over the edge. I tried to get into a fetal position and banged my knees against the wall. The location is at the Tsuen Wan end of the Red line, which is a bit out there, but closer to the airport by road. The saving grace of this hotel is the staff. They are very helpful and friendly and met our needs.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value”
Reviews.Author: jenmito
Reviews.Content: If you're not set on staying in the tourist areas of Tsim Tsai Tsui, Mong Kok or Central this hotel offers excellent value. I've looked into hostels and this hotel is actually cheaper than hostels in Mong Kok with an ensuite bathroom. Internet however was not free as advertised on the website (maybe I selected the wrong package) and my internet usage costed more than my hotel room - which illustrates how cheap the room was. It's about a 5 walk to the Tsuen Wan MRT station and close to a 7-11. There is a relatively new mall in Tsuen Wan about 20-30 minute walk but it not worth going if you're a tourist to Hong Kong. The staff speak English, Mandarin and Cantonese from what I've observed. There are smoking and non-smoking rooms, an in-room safe but there is no closet.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad but there are better hotels closer to Hong Kong Island”
Reviews.Author: TheLynams
Reviews.Content: Dorsett Far East, Hong Kong Good Things: Close to transport links. The Airport Express is about 5-7 minutes walk away and the Airbus drops you outside the door. Don't bother with the MTR Airport Express as you still have to change trains and walk 5 minutes up and down steps and flyovers. The bus is a third of the price, easy, comfy and you get to see the area and it is about the same time (45 mins) and has an automated stop announcement in English so you know when to get off . Clean but small rooms. Yes the rooms are as small as everyone says. The beds are smaller than standard doubles both in width and length and are very very firm. Yet if you are here to see Hong Kong and not to spend a lot of time in your room then it is fine. They are clean and the bathrooms are functional. The TV even has some English channels. Accommodating staff. We got put on a smoking floor but had requested non smoking when booking via a UK agent so if you hate smoking and the smell of smoke make sure you request this when booking as there are only 3 out of 16 floors that are non smoking. We moved after 2 nights when a room became available and were very grateful for this. The smell of smoke hits you quite badly as you step out of the lift and it seeps through under the bedroom door. It is not pleasant. Bad Things Distance from Hong Kong Despite being close to the metro, it is still a 40 minute train ride until you get to HK Island. If you can afford to stay closer to Kowloon it would be better. We stayed over NYE and we had no choice as it was the only place in our budget available. No ventilation. The windows do not open and the room gets quite stuffy and with condensation. The air con works well but has a funny smell to it. Not good if you re stuck on a smoking floor! The buffet breakfast. It costs $HK42 if booked in advance but if you like healthy breakfasts it is not worth it as it is mainly deep fried stuff. There are numerous cafés or bakeries in the area where you can get a better breakfast for slightly less. No WiFi. There is one PC on the 6th floor where it costs $HK30 per hour to use but no centralised WiFi which is a shame given it is such a modern hotel. Noise. The walls are paper-thin. Even with earplugs we could hear the screeching and high pitched talking of the neighbours and their TVs. Lifts. There are only 2 lifts and on one occasion we had to wait over 10 minutes to get down the lobby. Every time we started to walk down the stairs another lift would stop but with staff in there with trolleys etc. There doesn't appear to be a service lift and they use the main lifts. Overall Good value for money, clean and simple but if you can afford to stay closer to Kowloon or Hong Kong Island you can probably get the same value for money and spend less on getting around.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel......”
Reviews.Author: ilovehkQuezonCity
Reviews.Content: we stayed there for 2 nights... the rooms are very clean... i just dont like the guy in conceirge he gets angry so fast... the location is good.. there's a lot of shopping malls near... the foods are well prepared but not that delicious.. but over all i like this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “neat and cute tiny rooms!”
Reviews.Author: meeriah
Reviews.Content: we stayed at dorsett far east for 4 days just last september, we had a great time at this hotel especially the buffet breakfast, it was most convenient to have breakfast taken at the hotel than otherwise, especially if u got kids traveling with u, would have been hard for us to locate a nice place to eat before we hit our tours with kids tagging along, since we're not familiar with the place. rooms were A ok! tiny but really cute, so clean and neat and if i were to compare the housekeeping service to most hotels i stayed at in the USofA, theirs were more accomodating even though they don't speak very good english, they're very polite and would attend to your needs in a flash. there's just one guy in the front desk that i think shouldn't be there, so cold and unwelcoming. overall, it was a great place to stay in, so yeah i recommend this hotel if u plan to visit hongkong.

Reviews.Title: “SMALL ROOMS, GREAT LOCATION, VERY CLEAN”
Reviews.Author: gs89
Reviews.Content: Small double room but great location in busy area with shops, malls and very close to MTR short walk 10mins. Very safe area. cleaning staff was very good. room was very clean. would recommend this hotel if you like small value room. I paid $68CDN per night during New Years rate very good rate. MTR ride is approx. 15-20 to the TST area or HK Island. Bed was very short and shower very small.

Reviews.Title: “Affordable and convenient!”
Reviews.Author: Joyce23
Reviews.Content: My hubby and I were invited by our newly wed friends who were given a HK package gift from one of their relatives. We were at first hesitant on the hotel which we have to stay for according to our research it's far from the main city. I for myself had my vacation last 2006 in one of Nathan road's Hongkong hotel as for the rest of the group it was their first time. When we arrived, my first impression was it was a small hotel but when a I entered the room it was small as I read on reviews but it was clean and it has all the functional amenities. The room was cleaned from time to time and our things were secured. Staffs are helpful and courteous. There's a lot of food to choose from in the breakfast buffet. The fact the hotel rate is cheap they were able to provide good service and supply needs for their guests. I'll definitely go back to this hotel if time permits me to be in Hongkong again.

Reviews.Title: “still ok”
Reviews.Author: amylia
Reviews.Content: is no bad stay here..room are small but is clean.near subway station.but subway station to xim sa shui bout 25 min is far for me.will not stay there again.but is good hotel also.

Reviews.Title: “Just make sure you ask for a room with a window...”
Reviews.Author: sujitsu
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 3 nights in November 2008. The rooms are pretty small, which was ok for me, given that I was a lone female traveller, and that Heathrow airport had conveniently lost my luggage. However, for a couple or for a prolonged stay, or if you are pretty tall, you would probably be better off staying somewhere a bit bigger. One note of caution: on my first night, I was dismayed to find that I had been put in a room on the inside of the building with a fake window. Obviously space is a premium in HK, but it made me feel pretty uncomfortable. The staff were very nice about swapping... I did have to stay in that room on arrival but they did move me to a room with a real window the next morning. Also, the walls are quite thin and some residents will leave their doors wide open and have loud conversations between rooms into the small hours of the morning. But it's not threatening, just more annoying than anything. Finally, they didn't have wi fi in the rooms though, so make sure you take a network cable with you! Otherwise, the hotel is clean, convenient for getting to the amazing MTR system (although Tsuen Wan is about 20 minutes from the city centre). The staff speak English and are professional and polite.

Reviews.Title: “A Nice Hotel that gives you Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: uwantmebad17
Reviews.Content: My first trip to Hong Kong was full of anxiety. Nobody I knew can recently tell me how Hong Kong is. First thing that worried me was the hotel that we would stay in. I'm not sure whether it would be a Hotel worthy to be "Pimped" to others. The people manning the Front desk were professionals and courteous. They were even able to accommodate us before the check in time. And I believe we were upgraded to a deluxe room for free. Their command of the English language made communication a breeze. The rooms are perfect for Asians. I say this because I believe we Asians are built smaller on average compared to our caucasian friends. It is not too small and you can say that its size is comparable to its cost. The shower area though would be much better if expanded. Dorsett Far East Hotel, although far from the City Center, is very accessible. Bus stops are a few steps away, plus the ultra efficient MTR which is about an 8 min walk. Going around the city is a piece of cake. I would surely reserve in this Hotel again if I ever go back to Hong Kong. Given that others do not give out crazy deals.

Reviews.Title: “small, little bit far away from main city, but clean and convenient”
Reviews.Author: jcyat
Reviews.Content: i read many reviews of this hotel before chose it as my recommodation in hong kong. the first word i said when i entered the room was, "wow, the photographer has a really great technic to capture a small room into a big room!" but pleasure its clean. the toilet is really small, especially the shower. this hotel is very near mtr. i would like to introduce everybody who are going to stay in this hotel, try the local food such as 'steamed vermicelli roll, egg tart, bei jing meat pie, dim sum' near the mtr station instead of those bakery in the mall. jus turn right before you enter mtr station. lots of delicious local food sell over there. i and my friends gonna miss it. oh, and the curry fish ball which is just beside the mall also yummy! must try

Reviews.Title: “Value for money”
Reviews.Author: BabyPanda81
Reviews.Content: The hotel location is just a few mins walk away from Tsuen Wan MTR station.. room is clean and the staffs are nice.. though may not be very near to the famous ladies street in Mongkok..but MTR service is very fast ..accessible to every parts of Hongkong..there are shopping centres and food centres nearby too..

Reviews.Title: “An experience living in a domestic maid room”
Reviews.Author: SingaporePeter
Reviews.Content: One thing I like is the location of the hotel. It is near to the MTR and is good for new visitors who are unfamiliar to the bus routes when they want to travel to different destinations. 3 things I feel disappointed: - the room is so tiny that it is half the size of our dinning hall back home. - there are no tissue papers neither a proper wardrobe. The TV contents are so severely limited to choose from. - the room is not noise-proof that I could hear very clearly the conversation in the next-door during the night, disrupting my sleep. It is thus no value-for-money, worse than a budget hotel standards I expect.

Reviews.Title: “Tiny rooms but good location”
Reviews.Author: alwayslove2travel
Reviews.Content: The rooms are tiny and so are the bathrooms. There is no wardrobe space however the location is very good for travelling round Hong Kong. It's opposite the station and it's only a 15minute trip into the centre of Kowloon and another 5 minutes to Hong Kong Island.

Reviews.Title: “Small rooms but cozy”
Reviews.Author: khrise
Reviews.Content: small rooms but cozy, cold rooms, clean, nice LCD tv mounted on wall. wifi is expensive and isn't free. elevator is soo small. but overall it's not that bad.

Reviews.Title: “Budget Hotel”
Reviews.Author: lewis1985
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a cheap hotel in hong kong, i recommend this hotel. if you book through their own website, they usually have half price promotions on. i have stayed there twice now and there are good points and bad points. first the good points. the location of the hotel is not near the centre on kowloon, such as TST, or even near HK island but that isnt a bad thing! it is situated in Tsuen Wan, in the new territories, but is still close to kowloon area. the hotel is about a 5 minute walk to the closest MTR station (Tsuen Wan station, Tsuen Wan Line). this walk is very easy, you can even walk through a shopping arcade. Tsuen wan is a very interesting town. Due to it being out of the central of HK, the prices in shops are cheaper. there are a lot of restaurants, cheap and expensive and also 2 supermarkets at eaither end of the town. Regards to shopping, there are loads of shops and several huge department stores. Big bonus is that because its out of the main parts, less tourists, therefore less hassle from people trying to sell you fake bags/watches! The hotel is very basic and the rooms are small but its very cheap, so you pay for what you get. you get a tv with about 15 channels, most are chinese. bathroom is clean, yet small, but all working order. From the airport, its takes about 30 mins by train, about 45 mins to an hour by bus depending on route and traffic. Now the bad points: first: take your own pillow, mine was like a brick second: the staff dont speak that good english, so best to know where you want to go and how to get there before hand. thirdly, and probably the biggest problem for a lot of people, is that it isnt near HK island. the subway from Tsuen wan to TST takes roughly 25 mins, so its not too bad, plus the trian is very cheap and its direct to central Kowloon and HK Island. you have to way up paying extra for a more central hotel copared to travel expenses. i personally think transport is very cheap so it will always win. plus on the train, you see a lot of interesting characters. its a budget hotel so dont expect alot but whenever i go to hong kong, i aim to stay there as its cheap, friendly surroundings, and easy access to all of hong kong wether it be by train or bus

Reviews.Title: “Small room for small people but nice view.......”
Reviews.Author: The-Nice-Brit
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed in this hotel during a trip to visit her family in Tsuen Wan. On the plus side it is very convenient to the MTR station and the buffet breakfast was very enjoyable. Also we did have a nice view of the park from our window. Air con was good also. On the negative side the rom is VERY SMALL. Just large enough for a 6ft male such as myself. We had two large bags and although there was just enough room to put them on the floor it made it difficult to move around the room. In my case I chose the room nearest the window and had to climb into the bed over the bags every day. The foyer is also quite small and there are no facilities there such as a bar or seating area. Overall though for the price it was a reasoanable place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “The staff - were courteous. Rooms small but clean”
Reviews.Author: princessjon
Reviews.Content: HAve traveled to Hongkong before and have stayed in rooms 3x bigger than the one we stayed here in Dorsett. However, the rooms were definitely clean and bathrooms I give thumbs up. If you brought along bulky luggages - definitely a problem , it's good my husband just brought along 2 carry-all bags while I have a medium size luggage which we placed along the foot of my bed - very small room left to get to the bathroom. Airconditioning was great- actually had to shut it off by midnight- we were freezing. Most guests complained about the hard beds- for me they were perfect- I had a back problem and this is what I needed. Now for the staff - I am impressed by their courteousness and especially the Conceirge (?) he was a big guy at the hotel lobby who wore dark rimmed glasses - always had a smile in his face. serves as a good public relations in behalf of the hotel. Same with those at the recep- although sporting really serious faces they were quite accomodating.

Reviews.Title: “Budget hotel with pleasant design”
Reviews.Author: KikiMalaysia
Reviews.Content: Overall, this hotel is worth for money. The design is good, furnitures are new as it was only open in October, 2006, staffs are quite friendly and it is strategically located. This hotel is located in Tsuen Wan and it's about 10mins walk from the Tsuen Wan MTR station, which will be the most frequent place that you would go in HK. From HK airport to the hotel, I suggest to take the A31 citybus and get down in front of the citistore shopping complex (second last station). Public transports, e.g. bus, taxi, MTR, HK-style restaurants and 7-eleven are all easily accessible. The only drawback of this hotel is the rooms are not soundproof. During our stays in the hotel, most of the rooms are occupied by tourists from the Mainland and we could hardly sleep later than 8am as the tourists were making so much noises in the aisle as well as their rooms. They were running from a room to another and slammed the doors, this incident repeated every morning for not shorter than half an hour and it was totally unbearable.

HotelInfo.Name: Silka Far East Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: No.135-143 Castle Peak Road, Tsuen Wan, Kowloon, Hong Kong, China
